                <lb/>(Conference held at Hunter College, CUNY, August 28-September 1, 1984)

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The conference “New Perspectives on Caribbean Studies: Toward the 21st Century and Prospects for Caribbean Basin Integration,” sponsored by the Research Institute for the Study of Man (RISM) and the City University of New York (CUNY), was held at Hunter College, CUNY, in New York City, from August 28 – September 1, 1984. The conference provided an interdisciplinary forum for distinguished Caribbeanist scholars, government officials artists, and other participants to reflect on contemporary issues in the Caribbean region. The collection includes correspondence, proposals, conference programs, press releases, abstracts, published and unpublished manuscripts, clippings, articles, journals, photographs, audio and video recordings and transcripts, and an index to the audio and video recordings, transcripts and photographs. The collection contains material duplicated in the Vera D. Rubin Professional Papers.

p.value: Some restricted materials pertaining mainly to finances, internal administration, and private information remain at the Reed Foundation and are closed to researchers.

Series XVII. Digitized Audio and Video Recordings and Transcripts contains a three-volume duplicate original manuscript produced for institutional circulation by the Research Institute for the Study of Man (RISM) and InterAmericas, programs of The Reed Foundation. “New Perspectives on Caribbean Studies: Toward the 21st Century and Prospects for Caribbean Basin Integration” Transcripts of the Audio and Video Recordings, edited by Mercedes Duff with Danielle Davenport and Jane Gregory Rubin, is comprised of transcripts and digitized copies of the analog audio and video recordings in Series XVI, prints of video stills and selected photographs from Series VIII, and an index to the audio and video transcripts, photographs, and video stills. Spanish and Haitian Creole audio and video material was transcribed and translated by Danielle Davenport and James Larèche.

.5 linear feet (1 box) arranged chronologically. The series consists of incoming and outgoing correspondence generated by RISM and CUNY conference organizers. Papers in this series highlight planning details and initial outreach efforts to potential participants. Items of interest include correspondence and a report concerning visa restrictions that impacted some conference participants (see Folder 4).

1.0 linear feet (2 boxes), arranged chronologically. This series documents the efforts of RISM and CUNY conference organizers to gain support and promote interest in the conference. Included are minutes, conference programs, correspondence, mailing lists, form letters and invitations. Publicity materials include advertisements, press releases and conference announcements. A number of unique conference flyers and conference brochures are also included (see Box 4, folder 1 below, and Series XIV. Oversized Materials, Box 25). Hunter College newsletters provide a unique post-conference report (see Box 5, folders 29 - 32). For additional post-conference coverage, see Series VII. Clippings.

Conference Participants, November 1982 - November 1986 Scope and Contents note:

Approximately 3.5 linear feet (7 boxes), arranged alphabetically by last name. Representing the largest series in the collection, these files were maintained for individuals who presented papers, served as co-chairs or were discussants. The files include correspondence, personal greeting cards, abstracts, curriculum vitae, newsletters, journals and clippings. Items of note include Vera D. Rubin's opening remarks (see Box 12, Folder 130) and articles, book reviews and earlier writings by and about conference presenters. For the original manuscript papers delivered at the 1984 conference, see Series XI. Conference Manuscripts. Duplicate copies of the manuscripts, taken from the Library of Caribbean Research, are listed in the Appendix. A select number of these papers were also part of a planned publication (see Series XII. Yale Press Manuscripts and subsequently published (see Series XIII. Published Manuscripts).

.5 linear feet (1 box), arranged chronologically. This series, which consists of clippings from U.S. and Caribbean papers, has been organized as three subseries. Subseries a. relates to grant funding, Subseries b. contains articles on a wide range of international topics, and Subseries c. consists of post-conference articles. Oversized clippings have been transferred to Series XV. Oversized materials.

Photographs, August 28 - September 1, 1984 (at the Reed Foundation) Matierals in Series VIII. Subseries a, b, c, and d are at the Reed Foundation. Scope and Contents note:

Approximately 1.0 linear feet (1 box, 1 binder). This series is comprised of 108 negatives, 3 contact sheets, 69 photographic prints, photocopies of 5 contact sheets, and one disc containing 180 image files in TIFF format. All images originate from black and white 35 mm film. The disc and the photographic prints are located in a separate binder labeled Notebook 14A. The contents of the disc are described in Subseries a., b., and c., and the photographic prints are described in Subseries d. Subseries a. contains digitized copies of the negatives in Folder 4; Subseries b. contains digitized copies of contact sheets in Folder 3; Subseries c. contains digitized copies of the photographic prints in Subseries d. Images in Subseries a., b., c., and d. have been arranged by conference session, and assigned consecutive ID numbers, e.g. “CC84-01.” Digitized copies of photographic prints and corresponding original photographic prints have been assigned identical ID numbers.

Conference Manuscripts (unpublished) June 1984-January 1985 Scope and Contents note:

2.0 linear feet (4 boxes). Arranged in order of presentation (see conference programs, Box 16, Folder 1). Although some Mss. titles differ from those listed in the conference programs, this series consists of original conference manuscripts. Highlights include the opening remarks by Vera D. Rubin (see Folder 3), original art work, the closing address by former prime minister Michael Manley and papers associated with the award ceremony. Based on the correspondence and tally sheets in this series, some Mss. were revised or formalized after the conference for publication. Several Mss. were not submitted.

Yale University Press Manuscripts (unpublished) June 1984 - May 1987 Scope and Contents note:

1.5 linear feet (3 boxes). Arranged as chapters of the proposed publication (see Box 20, Folder 1). This series consists of a select number of conference manuscripts that were revised and reorganized for a planned submission to Yale University Press. Although the planned publication did not materialize, the papers in this series include chapter title pages, indicated in italics, lists of submissions and revised manuscripts.

Published Manuscripts Scope and Contents note:

.5 linear feet (1 box). Arranged chronologically. This series consists of a select number of manuscripts presented at the conference (see Series XI. Conference Manuscripts). Edited by Frank McGlynn, then Associate Professor of Anthropology at the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg, the papers were included in a special issue entitled "The Social Anthropology of the Contemporary Caribbean" published by the journal Third World Studies. Additional highlights in this series include a draft tribute and partial list bibliographic publications by Vera D. Rubin, written and compiled by Frank McGlynn for the preface (see Folder 1).

Audio and Video Recordings, August 1984 - March 1985 Scope and Contents note:

Approximately 2 linear feet (2 Paige boxes). This series contains 26 videotapes, 26 digibeta copies of the videotapes as well as 26 DVD copies of videotapes, 60 original audiotapes and 60 CD copies of original audiotapes. All tapes are arranged in numerical sequence. The videotapes are labeled with the prefix "68768" followed by the tape number (i.e.68768/1). The inventory treats the second number as the tape number. Series XVII. Digitized Audio and Video Recordings and Transcripts contains digitized copies of these audio and video recordings, transcripts, and indices to the audio and video transcripts.
